DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to indicate whether or not an individual was diagnosed with Barrett's Esophagus prior to esophageal tumor submission.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Esophageal segment lined with columnar metaplastic epithelium which is flat or villiform.  Barrett's epithelium is characterized by two different types of cells: goblet cells and columnar cells.  The symptomatology of Barrett's esophagus is that of gastro-esophageal reflux.  It is the precursor of most esophageal adenocarcinomas.  (WHO, 2000) -- 2003_The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Esophageal segment lined with columnar metaplastic epithelium which is flat or villiform.  Barrett's epithelium is characterized by two different types of cells: goblet cells and columnar cells.  The symptomatology of Barrett's esophagus is that of gastro-esophageal reflux.  It is the precursor of most esophageal adenocarcinomas.  (WHO, 2000) -- 2003

Concepts.definition: Esophageal lesion lined with columnar metaplastic epithelium which is flat or villiform. Barrett epithelium is characterized by two different types of cells: goblet cells and columnar cells. The symptomatology of Barrett esophagus is that of gastro-esophageal reflux. It is the precursor of most esophageal adenocarcinomas.  (WHO)

Property.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A country in Western Europe, comprising islands, including the northern one-sixth of the island of Ireland, between the North Atlantic Ocean and the North Sea, northwest of France. The US State Department considers Guernsey, Isle of Man, and Jersey as separate entities, each with its own code. (from CIA World Factbook 2002): The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: A country in western Europe, comprising islands, including England, Scotland, Wales, and the northern one-sixth of the island of Ireland, between the North Atlantic Ocean and the North Sea, northwest of France.
The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A country in North America, bordering both the North Atlantic Ocean and the North Pacific Ocean, between Canada and Mexico. (CIA World Factbook 2002): The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: A country in North America, between Canada and Mexico, bordering both the North Atlantic Ocean and the North Pacific Ocean.
The affirmative response to a question.
